review:
Buying plastic ware ? You must Check recycling number.  
No brand is above board. For your health and well being you must be vigilant.
Many premium water bottles are been sold as safe but are actually PET or with
harmful plastics.  
>>> The recycling numbers 1, 3, 6 and 7 should be avoided for use as water
bottles. These numbers are indicated inside the triangular recycling symbol.  
  
In the product description there is no mention of the type of plastic used or
the recycling numbers . Virgin plastic and food safe plastic are vague terms
and don't indicate the kind of plastic used.  
  
The first thing I checked after unpacking the bottles was the bottom where the
recycling number is indicated inside a triangle.  
Two bottles have the triangle and two don't !!  
The number inside the triangle is not easy to read. This is the most important
part of the bottle meant for water storage. Why is Tupperware not transparent
with sharing the recycling numbers. Are they selling inferior quality to us
Indians? From different angles they appear as different numbers.  
What type of plastic is used for making these bottles? With out recycling
numbers there is no guarantee of safety 👎  
  
Ergonomics, color, looks are all secondary in a water bottle.  
The most important aspect is the safety. The water we shall consume from these
bottles every day has to be free from chemicals that can get leached into it
from the bad plastic.  
  
They are good looking and well designed bottles  
I received , blue, green, yellow and orange colours. They are transparent and
the caps fit well and are leak proof.  
No issues with the appearance but quality of plastic ?????  
I think the Number on two bottles is five. Numbers 2, 4 and 5 are safe
plastics.  
I returned H2O bottles from cello as they had recycling No. 1 clearly marked
in the bottom but the Tupperware bottles don't even show the number clearly.  
  
Not expected this from Tupperware. 👎

First of all note that it's PET number is 2 & not 5. The answers in the
questions section also misguided me because many have said that it is 5. Also
the bottles which are supposed to have that printed on their bottoms are
missing the needed info. which raised doubts regarding it's genuinity.  
  
PET stands for 'polyethylene terephthalate', which is the resin grade used in
the manufacturing of the product.  
  
These bottles are PET 2, which are relativey safer than 1 but it is high
density polyethylene which is generally used for toys, chairs milk jugs etc,
but not safe enough for water storage for longer periods. They release
antimony and phthalates over time so it is better to avoid such.  
  
PET 5 is polypropelene which is a thermostatic polymer, which is used in
manufacturing of plastic cups, baby bottles, kitchen & microwaveable plastic
containers. So it is better to opt 5.  
  
Paying around 900 for these grade 2 bottles is too expensive and not safe.  
if glass & steel bottles are not possible at least opt for PET 5 bottles,
which are not as carcinogenic as other grades. hope this info. helps.  
cheers.

I had purchased Tupperware Aquasafe Water Bottle Set a year back, and I've
overall good experience.  
  
Here are my observations:  
  
1\. The product looks similar to its pics on Amazon.  
2\. These bottles are very durable. Easy to clean. No issue of foul smell. The
look is perfect.  
3\. The product is as per my expectation, and I don't have any complaint as
such.  
4\. Tupperware products have always been costly. So the cost of bottles didn't
surprise me.  
  
Verdict: I don't have any complaint

Only the bottle caps have a visible 5 rating. The bottle body on the other

reason why the codes are not mentioned on the bottle body unlike the cap.

Kudos for flipkart

Packaging for bottles as well as caps was very impressive. I received bottles
of different colours than shown (orange, light yellow, green and a different
lighter shade of purple). But they are great.

I just bought the Tupperware Aquasafe water bottle set. Here are the things
that I noted.  
  
Pros:  
1\. The water bottles look and feel very sturdy.  
2\. According to the Tupperware's description about this product, looks like
they are made from bpa free plastic which is a huge plus.  
3\. They are leak proof as long as you close it properly.  
4\. Colors are pleasant. Not too bright.  
  
Cons:  
1\. There was a very slight plasticky smell initially. But once it was washed
and kept open to let it air dry for a few hours the smell went away.  
2\. The biggest con according to me is the price. It costs more than double
compared to Cello bottles. I haven't tried Cello bottles so can't say anything
about their quality.  
  
Overall, if you are very specific about quality and bpa free bottles,
Tupperware Aquasafe bottles are the best option.  
I'm happy with my purchase.

Quality is good. Colours are pleasant. I read reviews before I bought and
there seem to be a confusion if these are PET 2 or PET 5. I checked all four
bottles and it says PET 5. However the bag it came in says PET 2. But this
might just be a case of improper packing from the seller. Apart from this the
packing was good and all bottles came in good shape. As usual Amazon was fast
in delivery. My only negative is that the bottles are a little too big (fat)
compared to your average bottle. This makes them hard to hold in your palm and
only two bottles fit in my fridge shelf where there used to fit 3 average
bottles.

It came with 4 different colors as promised.  
I see some reviews saying that the quality is not good, but I have a different
view. I already have two Tupperware 1L bottles that were more than 3 years
old. When comparing with that bottles, this feels light, more transparent.
(Which may get the feeling that the quality is not good or sturdy) But I must
say that it is able to handle hot water just fine, while washing it. I use
this bottle for refrigerator and keep it at my desk. I don't use this for hot
water. (Be it Tupperware or any other PET bottles, I don't use that to fetch
hot/warm water). I have a vacuum steel flask for that purpose. Those who want
to use for the purpose of office/home use, go for it, it worth every penny.  
  
I don't recommend using a Tupperware for travel purpose (car/train/bus),
because it may expose to direct sunlight without your notice and it may
contaminate your water, you may never know. Keep it indoors.

Good but material is thin when compared to other tupperware bottle
